DEFINITION: Gregorian calendar year of the catches (e.g., 1996)
Fishing time period within the reporting year. 0 = Jan–Dec; 1 = Jan–Mar; 2 = Apr–Jun; 3 = Jul–Sep; 4 = Oct–Dec
IOTC legacy code for the main IOTC fishing area where the catch occurred
IOTC legacy code and label for the fishing fleets
IOTC legacy code and label for the main types of fisheries
IOTC legacy code and label for the broader grouping of fisheries
IOTC legacy code and label for the fishery in which the catch was taken
IOTC legacy code and label for the type of fishing gear used
IOTC Working Party primarily responsible for the species
Broad group of species (e.g., billfish species)
Category of the species or taxon within the IOTC classification (e.g., seerfish)
Species caught and retained
Scientific name of the species
Family to which the species belongs
Taxonomic order of the species
Indicates whether the species is managed by the IOTC (TRUE / FALSE)
Indicates whether the taxon represents an aggregate of multiple species (TRUE / FALSE)
Indicates whether the species is of special interest to the IOTC (TRUE / FALSE)
Conservation status of the species according to the IUCN Red List
IOTC legacy code and label indicating whether the fish caught were retained or discarded
IOTC legacy code and label for the reason for retaining the catch onboard
IOTC legacy code for the unit used to report the retained catch
Amount of fish caught and retained, expressed in live-weight equivalent (metric tonnes)
